text:
My childhood was a mix of happy memories and difficult experiences. I grew up in a small town in the Midwest, and the people around me were kind, if a bit conservative. My family was made up of my mom, dad, and two older sisters. My mom and dad both worked hard to provide for us, and while they weren’t the most affectionate parents, they did their best to make sure we were taken care of. 

I was a curious and outgoing child, and I loved spending time outdoors. I was always asking questions and exploring the world around me. I was particularly interested in nature, and I could often be found hiking, fishing, or playing in the nearby woods. I was also an avid reader, and I loved to read books about knights, dragons, and magical creatures. 

My two sisters were very different from me. They were both shy and studious, and they were more focused on school than I was. This made our relationship a bit tense at times, as I felt like I was being judged for my more adventurous nature. Despite this, I still looked up to them and wanted to please them. 

I was also an active participant in school activities. I was never the star student, but I enjoyed learning and was always eager to participate in class discussions. I was also involved in sports, and I loved playing basketball and baseball. I was never the best player, but I enjoyed the competition and camaraderie. 

The biggest challenge of my childhood was dealing with my parents’ divorce. It was a difficult time for all of us, and I felt like I was caught in the middle. I remember feeling confused and angry, and I had a hard time understanding why my parents couldn’t stay together. I wanted to support them both, but it was hard to know how to do that. 

Despite the difficulties I faced, I still look back on my childhood fondly. I remember the good times I had with my family and friends, and the wonderful adventures I went on. I also remember the lessons I learned from my parents, and how they taught me to be independent and to always strive to do my best. 

My childhood was not perfect, but it was a time of growth and discovery. I’m thankful for the experiences I had, and the lessons I learned. They have helped shape me into the person I am today.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, conscientious, emotionally stable, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(b) Notices other people’s weak points

(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)

(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
